1.long: Jesus; the Greek form of Joshua; Jesus, son of Eliezer; Jesus, surnamed Justus.
called, invited, summoned by God to an office or to salvation.

1.brief: an apostle, a messenger, an envoy, a delegate
1.long: a messenger, envoy, delegate, one commissioned by another to represent him in some way, especially a man sent out by Jesus Christ Himself to preach the Gospel; an apostle.

1.brief: I rail off, separate, place apart
1.long: I rail off, separate, place apart.
into, in, unto, to, upon, towards, for, among.
the good news of the coming of the Messiah, the gospel; the gen. after it expresses sometimes the giver (God), sometimes the subject (the Messiah, etc.), sometimes the human transmitter (an apostle).

2.long: (a) gen: through, throughout, by the instrumentality of, (b) acc: through, on account of, by reason of, for the sake of, because of.
a prophet, poet; a person gifted at expositing divine truth.

2.long: he, she, it, they, them, same.

3.long: I come into being, am born, become, come about, happen.

3.long: from out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards.
(a) seed, commonly of cereals, (b) offspring, descendents.

loved, beloved, with two special applications: the Beloved, a title of the Messiah (Christ), as beloved beyond all others by the God who sent Him; of Christians, as beloved by God, Christ, and one another.

set apart by (or for) God, holy, sacred.

already; now at length, now after all this waiting.
at one time or other, at some time, formerly.

12.long: a weak adversative particle, generally placed second in its clause; but, on the other hand, and.

12.long: I invite, encourage along with others; pass: I share in encouragement with.

14.long: a foreigner, one who speaks neither Greek nor Latin; as adj: foreign.
